Russian internet hangs in the balance after network outages
description: Network outages have become increasingly frequent across Russia. Authorities justify these measures by citing the need to counter Ukrainian drone attacks. However, this also conceals a growing surveillance of Russians' online activities.

Tariffs: The EU's 'lost opportunity'
description: Although trade is one of the European Union's main areas of competence, the EU refused to enter into a trade conflict with President Donald Trump, risking its long-term credibility. France's voice was barely heard.

headline: Economist Dmitry Nekrasov: 'Only a handful of sanctions have had a serious effect on Putin's ability to continue the war'
description: Nekrasov, a former Kremlin adviser who joined the opposition and now lives in exile, discusses the EU's latest package of sanctions against Russia and their potential effectiveness.

headline: The 'code of silence' surrounding the Sahel's fallen soldiers
description: In Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger, military juntas have sought to downplay or even conceal military losses linked to the fight against jihadists. Even families are often left in the dark about the fate of their loved ones who have been declared missing.

headline: 'In the West Berlin squats, we argued but lived together': Karin Wieland, political rebel
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (2/6). In the late 1970s, Karin Wieland fled her small German town to live communally in an abandoned building in Kreuzberg, throwing herself into every cause of the era.

'Half the city lay in ruins': Hanns Zischler, the cultural memory of West Berlin
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (1/6). The actor, writer, translator, and photographer, a figure of Germany's artistic and intellectual scene, arrived in the walled-in city in the early 1970s. He never left, drawn by a vibrancy that set West Berlin apart from the rest of the Federal Republic of Germany at the time.

headline: Letters from prisoners held in solitary confinement: 'I feel like becoming violent again'
description: Le Monde asked five prisoners and a former inmate – the armed robber Rédoine Faïd, four drug traffickers, and a radicalized Islamist – to recount daily life in solitary confinement.
byline: Grégoire Biseau,  Lucie Soullier and  Thomas Saintourens

headline: Initial tariff impacts painful for auto, textile and chemical industries
description: Six months after Donald Trump introduced the first US tariffs, companies have started to feel the effects of a shock whose repercussions, though they have been contained for now, are likely to be long-lasting.
byline: Bastien Bonnefous,  Eric Albert and  Juliette Garnier
